Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell sank a jumper with only three-tenths of a second remaining, sealing the win for the Cavaliers.
Damian Lillard and Giannis Antetokounmpo combined for 75 points, each shooting around 55 percent from the field.
Milwaukee Bucks shot a remarkable 46% from beyond the arc.
Post-Match Reflections: The Milwaukee Bucks endured a heartbreaking defeat against the Cleveland Cavaliers, losing 114-113.
This marks the Bucks' fifth consecutive loss, leaving them with a disappointing 1-5 record through six games.
Head coach Doc Rivers made a notable change to the rotation, giving rookie Andre Jackson Jr. extended minutes over Pat Connaughton.
